title: Signaturgesetz (SigG)
title_en: Electronic Signatures and Trust Services Act
description: Das Signaturgesetz (SigG) bildet das nationale Implementierungsgesetz für die eIDAS-Verordnung (Verordnung (EU) Nr. 910/2014) in Liechtenstein gemäss EWR-Abkommen. Es benennt das Amt für Kommunikation als Aufsichtsbehörde für qualifizierte Vertrauensdiensteanbieter, regelt die Anerkennung elektronischer Signaturen und Siegel für Rechtszwecke und stellt die Konformitätsbewertungsanforderungen für qualifizierte Vertrauensdiensteanbieter fest. Das SigG gewährleistet die Interoperabilität von Vertrauensdiensten im gesamten EWR.

provisions.title: Art. 1. Zweck und Verhältnis zur eIDAS-Verordnung
provisions.content: This Law implements Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 (eIDAS) in Liechtenstein pursuant to the EEA Agreement and EEA Joint Committee Decision No 221/2018, establishing the national framework for electronic identification and trust services. The Law designates the Amt für Kommunikation as the supervisory body for qualified trust service providers established in Liechtenstein, establishes national procedures for the supervision of trust service providers and the management of the trusted list, and provides procedural requirements for the acceptance of trust services by Liechtenstein public authorities. Where eIDAS applies directly, this Law provides national supplementary measures only.

provisions.title: Art. 2. Aufsichtsbehörde (Supervisory Body)
provisions.content: The Amt für Kommunikation (AK) is designated as the supervisory body responsible for supervising qualified trust service providers established in Liechtenstein, in accordance with the requirements of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014. The AK shall establish and maintain the national trusted list of qualified trust service providers and the qualified trust services they provide, in the format specified by the European Commission. The AK shall cooperate with supervisory bodies of other EEA states and with the European Commission in matters relating to the supervision of trust services, and shall participate in applicable cross-border supervisory cooperation arrangements.

provisions.title: Art. 3. Qualifizierte Vertrauensdiensteanbieter
provisions.content: Trust service providers wishing to obtain qualified status shall submit a conformity assessment report issued by an accredited conformity assessment body together with an application to the AK. The AK shall assess the application and, where applicable requirements are satisfied, shall grant qualified status and include the provider on the trusted list within the period specified by eIDAS. Qualified trust service providers shall maintain their qualified status through ongoing compliance with applicable requirements and shall undergo conformity assessment at least every twenty-four months. The AK may suspend or withdraw qualified status where a provider no longer satisfies applicable requirements.

provisions.title: Art. 4. Konformitätsbewertungsstellen (Conformity Assessment Bodies)
provisions.content: Conformity assessments of trust service providers shall be carried out by conformity assessment bodies accredited in accordance with Regulation (EC) No 765/2008. The AK shall maintain a list of recognised conformity assessment bodies accredited to carry out trust service provider assessments and shall verify the continuing competence and impartiality of listed bodies. Where no conformity assessment body is accredited in Liechtenstein, providers may use bodies accredited in other EEA states for conformity assessment purposes, subject to mutual recognition arrangements. Conformity assessment reports shall be prepared in accordance with standards specified by the European Commission.

provisions.title: Art. 5. Rechtswirkung elektronischer Signaturen (Legal Effect)
provisions.content: Electronic signatures shall not be denied legal effect and admissibility as evidence in legal proceedings solely on the grounds that they are in electronic form or do not meet the requirements for qualified electronic signatures. A qualified electronic signature shall have the equivalent legal effect of a handwritten signature for all purposes under Liechtenstein law, unless otherwise specified by law. Public authorities in Liechtenstein shall accept qualified electronic signatures created with a qualified certificate issued by a qualified trust service provider included in a trusted list of an EEA state. The AK shall publish guidance for public authorities on the verification and acceptance of electronic signatures.

provisions.title: Art. 6. Elektronische Siegel (Electronic Seals)
provisions.content: Electronic seals shall not be denied legal effect and admissibility as evidence in legal proceedings solely on the grounds that they are in electronic form or do not meet the requirements for qualified electronic seals. A qualified electronic seal shall enjoy the presumption of integrity of the data and of correctness of the origin of the data to which the qualified electronic seal is linked. Legal persons, including public authorities, may use electronic seals to authenticate documents and data. Public authorities in Liechtenstein shall accept qualified electronic seals created by qualified trust service providers included in a trusted list of an EEA state for the purposes of official documents and administrative procedures.

provisions.title: Art. 7. Elektronische Zeitstempel (Time Stamps)
provisions.content: Electronic time stamps shall not be denied legal effect and admissibility as evidence in legal proceedings solely on the grounds that they are in electronic form or do not meet the requirements for a qualified electronic time stamp. A qualified electronic time stamp shall enjoy the presumption of the accuracy of the date and time it indicates and the integrity of the data to which the date and time are bound. Qualified electronic time stamps shall be accepted by Liechtenstein courts and public authorities for the purposes of establishing the date and time of electronic records in administrative and legal proceedings.

provisions.title: Art. 8. Elektronische Zustellung (Electronic Registered Delivery)
provisions.content: Data sent and received using a qualified electronic registered delivery service shall enjoy the presumption of the integrity of the data, the sending of that data by the identified sender, its receipt by the identified addressee, and the accuracy of the date and time of sending and receipt. Qualified electronic registered delivery services shall be accepted by public authorities in Liechtenstein for the delivery of official communications and notifications where electronic delivery is permitted under applicable law. Service providers providing qualified electronic registered delivery services shall comply with the security and reliability requirements established under eIDAS and applicable implementing acts.

provisions.title: Art. 9. Website-Authentifizierung
provisions.content: Qualified certificates for website authentication issued by qualified trust service providers shall certify the identity of the website operator and shall enable users to verify the authenticity of the website. Public sector websites in Liechtenstein shall, where technically and operationally feasible, use qualified certificates for website authentication obtained from qualified trust service providers included in a trusted list. The AK shall issue guidance on the use of qualified certificates for website authentication by public authorities and shall monitor developments in applicable technical standards for website authentication.

provisions.title: Art. 10. Sicherheitsanforderungen
provisions.content: Trust service providers shall take appropriate technical and organisational measures to manage the risks posed to the security of the trust services they provide. Security measures shall ensure a level of security appropriate to the degree of risk and shall address key management, certificate issuance procedures, physical security, access control, and incident detection and response. Trust service providers shall notify the AK without undue delay and within the timeframe specified by eIDAS of any breach of security or loss of integrity that has a significant impact on a trust service provided or on personal data. The AK shall assess the notification and shall take appropriate action, coordinating with other relevant authorities as necessary.

provisions.title: Art. 11. Haftung (Liability)
provisions.content: Trust service providers shall be liable for damages caused intentionally or negligently to any natural or legal person due to a failure to comply with the obligations of this Law or of eIDAS. A qualified trust service provider shall be presumed to have acted intentionally or negligently unless it proves that the damage occurred without intent or negligence. Trust service providers may limit their liability in relation to the use of services beyond specified limits as specified in the terms and conditions of the service, provided that such limitations are clear, accessible, and non-discriminatory. Liability shall not be excluded for wilful misconduct or gross negligence.

provisions.title: Art. 12. Anerkennung von Drittstaaten-Diensten
provisions.content: Trust services provided by trust service providers established in third countries shall be recognised in Liechtenstein as equivalent to EEA qualified trust services where they originate from a third country with which Liechtenstein or the EEA has concluded a recognition agreement, and where the trust services concerned comply with the requirements of such an agreement. The AK shall maintain information on applicable recognition agreements and shall publish guidance on the recognition of third-country trust services for use by public authorities and private sector entities. Liechtenstein shall participate in applicable EEA cooperation mechanisms for the assessment of third-country trust services.

provisions.title: Art. 13. Sanktionen
provisions.content: Administrative sanctions applicable to trust service providers that fail to comply with this Law or eIDAS shall be proportionate and dissuasive. The AK may impose sanctions including public warnings, requirements for corrective action, suspension or withdrawal of qualified status, and administrative fines. Before imposing an administrative sanction, the AK shall give the trust service provider concerned an adequate opportunity to make representations. Decisions imposing sanctions may be appealed through the available administrative and judicial appeal procedures. The AK shall report annually on enforcement actions taken against trust service providers.

provisions.title: Art. 14. Nationales Identifikationssystem
provisions.content: Liechtenstein shall maintain a national electronic identification system enabling citizens and businesses to authenticate electronically with public authorities and private sector service providers. The national electronic identification system shall meet the assurance levels specified under eIDAS and shall be designed to be interoperable with electronic identification systems of other EEA states. The AK shall coordinate the technical development and operation of the national electronic identification system and shall notify it to the European Commission for recognition under eIDAS where applicable requirements are satisfied. Citizens shall be informed of the options available for electronic identification and the assurance levels applicable to different online services.

provisions.title: Art. 15. Interoperabilität
provisions.content: The AK shall promote the interoperability of trust services and electronic identification systems between Liechtenstein and other EEA states, participating in relevant cross-border interoperability testing and working groups. Technical specifications and standards for interoperability shall be developed in accordance with applicable Commission implementing acts and EEA decisions. The AK shall cooperate with the supervisory bodies of other EEA states in addressing interoperability issues and shall report annually on the state of interoperability of Liechtenstein's trust services and electronic identification systems with those of other EEA states.

provisions.title: Art. 16. Beziehung zu anderen Vorschriften
provisions.content: This Law applies without prejudice to applicable contract law, consumer protection law, data protection law, and other law governing the conduct of trust service providers and the use of trust services in Liechtenstein. The acceptance of electronic signatures and other trust services under this Law shall not affect the validity or enforceability of any other applicable legal requirement applicable to a particular type of transaction. The AK shall publish guidance on the application of this Law in the context of applicable sector-specific requirements and shall coordinate with relevant sectoral regulators to ensure a consistent approach.

definitions.definition: An electronic service normally provided for remuneration consisting of the creation, verification, and validation of electronic signatures, electronic seals, electronic time stamps, electronic registered delivery services, website authentication, or related certificates.
A natural or legal person who provides one or more trust services either as a qualified or as a non-qualified trust service provider.
A trust service that meets the applicable requirements established in eIDAS and is provided by a qualified trust service provider included on a trusted list.
A body accredited under Regulation (EC) No 765/2008 to carry out conformity assessments of trust service providers against the requirements of eIDAS.
